premise_source_doc_sentence: François de Belleforest  (  1530 -- 1 January 1583  )  was a prolific French author , poet and translator of the Renaissance .

claim: Francois de Belleforest translated the oeuvre of Sebastian Munster into French.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He spent some time in the court of Marguerite of Navarre , traveled to Toulouse and Bordeaux  (  where he met George Buchanan  )  , and then to Paris where he came into contact with members of the young literary generation , including Pierre de Ronsard , Jean Antoine de Baïf , Jean Dorat , Remy Belleau , Antoine Du Verdier and Odet de Turnèbe .

claim: Francois de Belleforest translated the oeuvre of Sebastian Munster into French.

Francois de Belleforest translated the oeuvre of Sebastian Munster into French.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Belleforest wrote on cosmography , morals , literature and history , and he translated the works of Matteo Bandello , Boccaccio , Antonio de Guevara , Lodovico Guicciardini , Polydore Vergil , Saint Cyprian , Sebastian Münster , Achilles Tatius , Cicero and Demosthenes into French .

premise_source_doc_sentence: It uses the known sources of Shakespeare 's Hamlet to tell a story that draws on a rather straightforward revenge tale in the medieval Denmark depicted by Saxo Grammaticus in his twelfth-century Historiae Danicae , but incorporates extra plot elements added by François de Belleforest in his Histoires tragiques , published in 1576 .
